paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene in the context of familial amyloid polyneuropathy (ATTR-FAP) and reports on the p.TTRV30M variant, including patient demographics and penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: ATTR-FAP with symptoms affecting nerves, heart, gastrointestinal tract, kidneys, and eyes

functional_data.summary: The p.TTRV30M variant is associated with ATTR-FAP, leading to amyloid fibril deposition.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is the most common mutation associated with ATTR-FAP.
key_quotes: The most common mutation is Val30Met.
ATTR-FAP is characterized by the deposition of TTR amyloid fibrils in different organ systems.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the relevant variant data was clearly presented.
